settings.heading: 🧾 Wholesale & Sales Tax Exemption Requirements
settings.row_content: To purchase wholesale (tax-exempt) from us, we need a copy of your resale certificate or exemption form. Requirements vary by state — please review the list below before submitting your documentation.

settings.heading: ✅ States That Require a State Resale Certificate
settings.row_content:
Submit a state-issued resale certificate (or seller’s permit) if you're located in:

  • Alabama – Sales Tax License
  • Arizona – Transaction Privilege Tax (TPT) License
  • California – CDTFA Seller’s Permit
  • Colorado – Sales Tax License
  • Connecticut – Resale Certificate (Form OR-219)
  • Florida – Annual Resale Certificate
  • Georgia – ST-5 Certificate
  • Hawaii – GET License
  • Illinois – CRT-61 Certificate
  • Indiana – ST-105 Certificate
  • Iowa – Sales Tax Exemption Certificate
  • Kansas – ST-28A Certificate
  • Kentucky – 51A105 Resale Certificate
  • Louisiana – R-1042 Certificate
  • Maine – Retail Certificate Number
  • Maryland – Sales & Use License
  • Massachusetts – ST-4 Certificate
  • Michigan – Form 3372
  • Minnesota – ST3 Certificate
  • Mississippi – Sales Tax Permit
  • Missouri – Form 149
  • Nebraska – Form 13
  • Nevada – Sales Tax Permit + Certificate
  • New Jersey – ST-3 Certificate
  • New Mexico – NTTC Certificate
  • New York – ST-120 Certificate
  • North Carolina – E-595E Form
  • North Dakota – Sales Tax Permit
  • Ohio – STEC-U or STEC-B
  • Oklahoma – Resale Permit
  • Pennsylvania – REV-1220 Certificate
  • Rhode Island – Resale Certificate
  • South Carolina – ST-8A Certificate
  • South Dakota – Sales Tax License
  • Tennessee – Certificate of Resale
  • Texas – Form 01-339
  • Utah – TC-721 Certificate
  • Vermont – S-3 Certificate
  • Virginia – ST-10 Certificate
  • Washington – Reseller Permit
  • West Virginia – Exemption Certificate
  • Wisconsin – S-211 Certificate
  • Wyoming – Sales Tax License + Certificate

settings.heading: 📄 States That Accept the Multistate Uniform Sales Tax Certificate
settings.row_content:
These states allow use of the MTC Uniform Sales & Use Tax Certificate:

Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Hawaii, Idaho, Illinois, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Maine, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, Nevada, New Jersey, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Washington, West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming

👉 Download the MTC Form (PDF)

settings.heading: 🚫 States With No Sales Tax
settings.row_content:
If you’re based in one of these states, no documentation is required:

  • Delaware
  • Montana
  • New Hampshire
  • Oregon
  • Alaska (note: some cities do charge local sales tax)

settings.text: Email us at bayandstew@gmail.com or upload your certificate during your wholesale application checkout.
